headline: Can AI Legally Turn $100,000 Into $1 Million? Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman Says That's The Real Test Of Intelligence
summary: On Monday, Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman says the next milestone toward artificial general intelligence won't be about sounding human, but about whether an AI agent can independently and legally create real economic value. A New Take On The Turing Test Taking to X, Suleyman reframed the decades-old Turing Test for the modern AI era, writing, "The next big milestone I’m watching for on our way to AGI: Artificial Capable Intelligence (ACI). headline: The Bull Case For Kenvue (KVUE) Could Change Following New Asia-Pacific CMO Appointment - Learn Why
summary: Kenvue has appointed Madhav Nayak as Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for the Asia-Pacific region, bringing experience from Yum! headline: Beating Back the Bubble: A Defensive Fund Portfolio for These Times
summary: Like snowflakes, every stock market bubble is unique.  The S&P 500 currently has a hefty 35% tech weighting, but even that understates the AI-related concentration, as the benchmark categorizes Google parent  Alphabet  and Facebook parent  Meta Platforms  as part of the “communication services” sector, and  Tesla  and  Amazon.com  as “consumer cyclicals.”  Brian Kersmanc, a portfolio manager at  GQG Partners  co-wrote a recent report titled “Dotcom on Steroids,” which explained why the firm thinks the market’s AI frenzy is worse than the dot-com bubble.

content.title: Beating Back the Bubble: A Defensive Fund Portfolio for These Times
content.summary: Like snowflakes, every stock market bubble is unique.  The S&P 500 currently has a hefty 35% tech weighting, but even that understates the AI-related concentration, as the benchmark categorizes Google parent  Alphabet  and Facebook parent  Meta Platforms  as part of the “communication services” sector, and  Tesla  and  Amazon.com  as “consumer cyclicals.”  Brian Kersmanc, a portfolio manager at  GQG Partners  co-wrote a recent report titled “Dotcom on Steroids,” which explained why the firm thinks the market’s AI frenzy is worse than the dot-com bubble.

headline: China Reviews Meta’s $2 Billion Deal to Buy AI Startup Manus
summary: Regulators have begun a review of the transaction unveiled in December, including possible national security implications, people familiar with the matter said.  Worth more than $2 billion, the deal will be assessed for its consistency with relevant laws and regulations, Ministry of Commerce spokesman He Yadong said at a regular briefing.  Founded in China and now based in Singapore, Manus drew global renown for its progress with building artificial intelligence agents.

content.title: China Reviews Meta’s $2 Billion Deal to Buy AI Startup Manus
content.summary: Regulators have begun a review of the transaction unveiled in December, including possible national security implications, people familiar with the matter said.  Worth more than $2 billion, the deal will be assessed for its consistency with relevant laws and regulations, Ministry of Commerce spokesman He Yadong said at a regular briefing.  Founded in China and now based in Singapore, Manus drew global renown for its progress with building artificial intelligence agents.

headline: China to assess, investigate Meta's acquisition of AI startup Manus
summary: China will assess ​and investigate Meta's ‌acquisition of artificial intelligence startup ‌Manus, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday. Companies engaging in ⁠activities such ‌as foreign investment, technology exports, data ‍transfers abroad and acquisitions must comply with Chinese ​laws and regulations, ‌ministry spokesperson He Yadong said at a press briefing. The ministry will work with relevant ⁠departments to conduct ​an assessment ​and investigation into the consistency of this ‍acquisition ⁠with laws and regulations, He said.

content.title: China to assess, investigate Meta's acquisition of AI startup Manus
content.summary: China will assess ​and investigate Meta's ‌acquisition of artificial intelligence startup ‌Manus, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Thursday. Companies engaging in ⁠activities such ‌as foreign investment, technology exports, data ‍transfers abroad and acquisitions must comply with Chinese ​laws and regulations, ‌ministry spokesperson He Yadong said at a press briefing. The ministry will work with relevant ⁠departments to conduct ​an assessment ​and investigation into the consistency of this ‍acquisition ⁠with laws and regulations, He said.

headline: China to probe Meta's acquisition of artificial intelligence startup Manus
summary: China said on Thursday it would assess and investigate Meta’s acquisition of artificial intelligence startup Manus, in a move highlighting its technology rivalry with the U.S..  Meta announced last week it was buying Manus, which is Singapore-based with Chinese roots, as the California tech giant behind Facebook and Instagram expands its AI offerings across its platforms.  It is a rare acquisition by a U.S. tech group of an AI company with Chinese roots, at a time of heightened frictions between Washington and Beijing.

content.title: China to probe Meta's acquisition of artificial intelligence startup Manus
content.summary: China said on Thursday it would assess and investigate Meta’s acquisition of artificial intelligence startup Manus, in a move highlighting its technology rivalry with the U.S..  Meta announced last week it was buying Manus, which is Singapore-based with Chinese roots, as the California tech giant behind Facebook and Instagram expands its AI offerings across its platforms.  It is a rare acquisition by a U.S. tech group of an AI company with Chinese roots, at a time of heightened frictions between Washington and Beijing.

headline: Meta Pauses Global Launch Of Ray-Ban Smart Glasses After US Rush
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is delaying its planned international rollout of the Ray-Ban Display smart glasses as demand in the U.S. has rapidly outpaced supply, forcing the company to rethink its global launch timeline. Meta had initially targeted early 2026 launches in markets including the U.K., France, Italy, and Canada. However, strong domestic demand has pushed U.S. customer waitlists “well into 2026,” prompting the company to prioritize fulfilling orders at home before expanding ove

headline: Defiance’s XMAG ETF, the First ETF Offering Exposure to the S&P 500 Excluding the “Magnificent Seven,” Surpasses $100 Million in AUM

XMAG is designed to provide investors with exposure to the S&P 500 while excluding the “Magnificent Seven” technology companies:

headline: Best Stock Trade of 2025 Keeps Running, Question Is for How Long
summary: Memory and storage companies were the leading performers in the S&P 500 Index last year, as the massive amounts of cash being spent on building out AI infrastructure trickled down to some traditionally staid parts of the tech sector.  Sandisk popped 16% on the first trading day of the year and then soared 28% on Tuesday after Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted the need for more memory and storage in the AI ecosystem.

content.title: Best Stock Trade of 2025 Keeps Running, Question Is for How Long

Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted the need for more memory and storage in the AI ecosystem.

headline: Meta's $2 Billion Manus AI Acquisition Will Face Scrutiny From China
summary: China's commerce ministry said it is will review Meta Platforms' $2 billion acquisition of the AI startup Manus.  Meta stock edged lower Thursday morning.  The regulators will investigate whether the deal complies with China's rules on export controls, technology transfer and foreign investment, according to the Wall Street Journal.

content.title: Meta's $2 Billion Manus AI Acquisition Will Face Scrutiny From China
content.summary: China's commerce ministry said it is will review Meta Platforms' $2 billion acquisition of the AI startup Manus.  Meta stock edged lower Thursday morning.  The regulators will investigate whether the deal complies with China's rules on export controls, technology transfer and foreign investment, according to the Wall Street Journal.

headline: Exus Renewables North America Closes $400 Million Facility to Meet Surging Power Demand
summary: Exus Renewables North America (Exus), a leading independent owner, developer and operator of utility-scale renewable energy projects, announced the closing of a $400 million senior secured corporate credit facility.
